answers.answer: Hi!The thyroid tests and vitamin B 12 tests are all within normal limits. This means you neither have a thyroid problem nor vitamin B 12 deficiency. If the tests were done due to fatigue, and other such symptoms then you also need to rule out electrolyte imbalance, diabetes, and iron deficiency. Take care!

question: i have got my blood tested.it says "suggesting thyronormalcy".the report is as follows:-test name                                                       value         units                  reference rangethyroid stimulating harmone (TSH)                     1.18          uIU/ml                  0.30 - 5.5free triiodothyronine (FT3)                                  2.9           pg/ml                   1.7 - 4.2free thyroxine (FT4)                                           0.99         ng/dl                     0.70-1.80i also tested for VITB-12.I got the value 255 when the reference range is 211-911 pg/ml.my certain body parts such as the thighs and arms were increasing in size.im only 16 with 73kg weight inspite of having a normal diet and regular long walks.i would like to know what the reports means and do i have thyroid problem.
title: thyroid normalcy
